structure.unit: Executive And Administrative Officers Of The Commonwealth
The Governor, Lieutenant Governor And Council, Certain Officers Under The Governor And Council, And State Library

law.catch_line: Powers And Duties In Preserving Underwater Archaeological Resources; State Title; Definition

text.section: cooperate with all departments, boards, officials and institutions of the commonwealth and its political subdivisions that are concerned with matters under its supervision;
cooperate and consult with appropriate federal agencies or the agencies of other states;
determine after a public hearing, if the board deems such a hearing in the public interest, whether certain objects found under the waters of the commonwealth are of historical value.

enter into agreements relative to the federal administration and enforcement of underwater exploration and removal or salvage of underwater archaeological resources beyond the coastal waters of the commonwealth;

apply for, receive and expend such federal funds or private grants as may be available therefor and accept gifts, contributions and bequests of funds, equipment and property from individuals, organization, and government entities, in carrying out its duties;
request assistance from appropriate state and local agencies and private organizations and individuals.

adopt, after public hearing, such rules and regulations regarding reporting and permit requirements for the removal and salvage of underwater archaeological resources as will insure the protection of their historical and educational value;

grant permits in accordance with section sixty-three of chapter ninety-one to qualified persons, organizations, or corporations for the orderly salvage or removal of underwater archaeological resources;
oversee the salvage and recovery operations by said permit holders;

compile and maintain an inventory of underwater archaeological resources reported and recovered under the provisions of this section and section sixty-three of chapter ninety-one, which shall not be a public record; and.

designate underwater archaeological preserves to provide special protection to those underwater archaeological resources of substantial historical value reported under the provisions of this section and section sixty-three of chapter ninety-one.
